background_description: The background consists of rough, deeply textured tree bark with numerous cracks, ridges, and crevices. The colors of the bark are predominantly muted shades of grey, brown, and some darker, almost black, areas in the shadows of the deeper fissures. The surface is uneven and fragmented.
explanation: The spider exhibits excellent camouflage, blending remarkably well with the tree bark. Its body color is a mottled greyish-brown, closely matching the dominant tones and irregular patterns of the bark. The rough, textured appearance of the spider's body also mimics the coarse surface of the bark, contributing significantly to its concealment. There is a low contrast difference between the spider and its immediate surroundings, making its outline indistinct. The patterns on its body help to break up its shape, further integrating it into the visual complexity of the bark. It is initially very difficult to spot without close inspection.
